The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

SET sName: (sName_de)
END IF ((dir = "To" OR dir = "Both") AND (toType != "Relation Node")) POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm}) ENDIF
START IF ((dir = "From" OR dir = "Both") AND (fromType != "Relation Node")) POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm}) ENDIF

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

CHAPTER "Semantic Enrichment" ATTR "Annotation" ATTR "Set Annotation" no-param push-button

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off
AVAL set-default:"Task" toType:"ToType" AVAL set-default:"Task" fromType:"FromType" AVAL showName:"Show name" AVAL name:"Name" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
PEN style:dash w:0.06cm EDGE PEN w:0.03cm FILL color:white
START IF (fromType != "Relation Node") ELLIPSE x:0cm y:0cm rx:0.1cm ry:0.1cm ENDIF
END IF (toType != "Relation Node") POLYGON 3 x1:-.33cm y1:-.11cm x2:0.0cm y2:0.0cm x3:-.33cm y3:0.11cm ENDIF
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Pool", "Pool (collapsed)", "Task", "Sub-Process", "Choreography Task", "Sub-Choreography", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType = "Start Event") OR (toType = "End Event") OR ((fromType = "Relation Node") AND (toType = "Relation Node"))) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).
